intro: Raillardella nevadensis, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada lily, is a flowering plant native to the Sierra Nevada mountain range in California. It is a member of the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as meadows and forested areas. Raillardella nevadensis is known for its delicate, grass-like foliage and is often found in alpine regions. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
